definition: to reduce payment/to annul (debts, bills, taxes etc)/to let sb off paying
to excuse sb/to exempt/to remove or dismiss from office/to avoid/to avert/to escape/to be prohibited

sentences.english: Geography can no longer be used as an excuse for absolving itself of any responsibility in the region.
sentences.chinese: 地理不再被用来作为宽免其在此地区自身责任的借口。

sentences.english: Provided that nothing herein shall relieve the agent from liability to prosecution.
sentences.chinese: 但本条的规定，并不宽免该代理人受检控的法律责任。

sentences.english: Can the Church give a dispensation from these impediments?
sentences.chinese: 圣教会能宽免婚配的阻碍么？

sentences.english: Waive rates for 2010-11, capped at $1,500 per quarter.
sentences.chinese: 宽免全年差饷，每户每季以1，500元为上限。

sentences.english: It exonerated the ship's officers and crew.
sentences.chinese: 宽免了船上所有的英国军官和水手。

definition: to stipulate/to state expressly/to explicitly provide for
to expose (e.g., wrongdoing)/to accuse (in court)/to impeach/to denounce
to decide (in a meeting)/to resolve (i.e. pass a resolution)
to prevent/to avoid/to excuse/to exempt/to relieve/(of a debt) to remit
